injectables.name: NativeDateAdapter

properties.name: _clampDate
properties.description: Whether to clamp the date between 1 and 9999 to avoid IE and Edge errors.

properties.name: useUtcForDisplay
properties.description:
Whether to use timeZone: 'utc' with Intl.DateTimeFormat when formatting dates. Without this Intl.DateTimeFormat sometimes chooses the wrong timeZone, which can throw off the result. (e.g. in the en-US locale new Date(1800, 7, 14).toLocaleDateString() will produce '8/13/1800'.

TODO(mmalerba): drop this variable. It's not being used in the code right now. We're now getting the string representation of a Date object from it's utc representation. We're keeping it here for sometime, just for precaution, in case we decide to revert some of these changes though.

properties.name: locale
properties.description: The locale to use for all dates.

methods.name: _2digit
methods.description: Pads a number to make it two digits.

methods.name: _createDateWithOverflow
methods.description: Creates a date but allows the month and date to overflow.

methods.name: _format
methods.description: When converting Date object to string, javascript built-in functions may return wrong results because it applies its internal DST rules. The DST rules around the world change very frequently, and the current valid rule is not always valid in previous years though. We work around this problem building a new Date object which has its internal UTC representation with the local date and time.

jsdoctags.comment: Intl.DateTimeFormat object, containg the desired string format. It must have timeZone set to 'utc' to work fine.
Date from which we want to get the string representation according to dtf
A Date object with its UTC representation based on the passed in date info

methods.name: _stripDirectionalityCharacters
methods.description: Strip out unicode LTR and RTL characters. Edge and IE insert these into formatted dates while other browsers do not. We remove them to make output consistent and because they interfere with date parsing.

jsdoctags.comment: The string to strip direction characters from.

methods.name: deserialize
methods.description: Returns the given value if given a valid Date or null. Deserializes valid ISO 8601 strings (https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt) into valid Dates and empty string into null. Returns an invalid date for all other values.

methods.name: addCalendarDays
methods.description: Adds the given number of days to the date. Days are counted as if moving one cell on the calendar for each day.

jsdoctags.comment: The number of days to add (may be negative).
A new date equal to the given one with the specified number of days added.

methods.name: addCalendarMonths
methods.description: Adds the given number of months to the date. Months are counted as if flipping a page on the calendar for each month and then finding the closest date in the new month. For example when adding 1 month to Jan 31, 2017, the resulting date will be Feb 28, 2017.

jsdoctags.comment: The number of months to add (may be negative).
A new date equal to the given one with the specified number of months added.

methods.name: addCalendarYears
methods.description: Adds the given number of years to the date. Years are counted as if flipping 12 pages on the calendar for each year and then finding the closest date in the new month. For example when adding 1 year to Feb 29, 2016, the resulting date will be Feb 28, 2017.

jsdoctags.comment: The number of years to add (may be negative).
A new date equal to the given one with the specified number of years added.

methods.name: clampDate
methods.description: Clamp the given date between min and max dates.

jsdoctags.comment: The minimum value to allow. If null or omitted no min is enforced.
The maximum value to allow. If null or omitted no max is enforced.
min if date is less than min, max if date is greater than max, otherwise date.

methods.name: compareDate

jsdoctags.comment: 0 if the dates are equal, a number less than 0 if the first date is earlier, a number greater than 0 if the first date is later.

The month of the date (0-indexed, 0 = January). Must be an integer 0 - 11.

The new date, or null if invalid.

methods.name: deserialize
methods.description: Attempts to deserialize a value to a valid date object. This is different from parsing in that deserialize should only accept non-ambiguous, locale-independent formats (e.g. a ISO 8601 string). The default implementation does not allow any deserialization, it simply checks that the given value is already a valid date object or null. The <oui-datepicker> will call this method on all of it's @Input() properties that accept dates. It is therefore possible to support passing values from your backend directly to these properties by overriding this method to also deserialize the format used by your backend.

jsdoctags.comment: The value to be deserialized into a date object.
The deserialized date object, either a valid date, null if the value can be deserialized into a null date (e.g. the empty string), or an invalid date.

injectables.name: OuiIconRegistry

properties.name: _iconSetConfigs
properties.description: SvgIconConfig objects and cached SVG elements for icon sets, keyed by namespace. Multiple icon sets can be registered under the same namespace.

properties.name: _inProgressUrlFetches
properties.description: In-progress icon fetches. Used to coalesce multiple requests to the same URL.

properties.name: _svgIconConfigs
properties.description: URLs and cached SVG elements for individual icons. Keys are of the format

methods.name: _createSvgElementForSingleIcon
methods.description: Creates a DOM element from the given SVG string, and adds default attributes.

methods.name: _extractIconWithNameFromAnySet
methods.description: Searches the cached SVG elements for the given icon sets for a nested icon element whose "id" tag matches the specified name. If found, copies the nested element to a new SVG element and returns it. Returns null if no matching element is found.

methods.name: _extractSvgIconFromSet
methods.description: Searches the cached element of the given SvgIconConfig for a nested icon element whose "id" tag matches the specified name. If found, copies the nested element to a new SVG element and returns it. Returns null if no matching element is found.

methods.name: _fetchUrl
methods.description: Returns an Observable which produces the string contents of the given URL. Results may be cached, so future calls with the same URL may not cause another HTTP request.

methods.name: _getSvgFromConfig
methods.description: Returns the cached icon for a SvgIconConfig if available, or fetches it from its URL if not.

methods.name: _getSvgFromIconSetConfigs
methods.description: Attempts to find an icon with the specified name in any of the SVG icon sets. First searches the available cached icons for a nested element with a matching name, and if found copies the element to a new <svg> element. If not found, fetches all icon sets that have not been cached, and searches again after all fetches are completed. The returned Observable produces the SVG element if possible, and throws an error if no icon with the specified name can be found.

methods.name: _loadSvgIconFromConfig
methods.description: Loads the content of the icon URL specified in the SvgIconConfig and creates an SVG element from it.

methods.name: _loadSvgIconSetFromConfig
methods.description: Loads the content of the icon set URL specified in the SvgIconConfig and creates an SVG element from it.

methods.name: _setSvgAttributes
methods.description: Sets the default attributes for an SVG element to be used as an icon.

methods.name: _svgElementFromString
methods.description: Creates a DOM element from the given SVG string.

methods.name: _toSvgElement
methods.description: Converts an element into an SVG node by cloning all of its children.

methods.name: addSvgIcon
methods.description: Registers an icon by URL in the default namespace.

jsdoctags.comment: Name under which the icon should be registered.

methods.name: addSvgIconLiteral
methods.description: Registers an icon using an HTML string in the default namespace.

jsdoctags.comment: Name under which the icon should be registered.

methods.name: addSvgIconSet
methods.description: Registers an icon set by URL in the default namespace.

methods.name: getNamedSvgIcon
methods.description: Returns an Observable that produces the icon (as an <svg> DOM element) with the given name and namespace. The icon must have been previously registered with addIcon or addIconSet; if not, the Observable will throw an error.

injectables.description:
Service to register and display icons used by the <oui-icon> component.

  • Registers icon URLs by namespace and name.
  • Registers icon set URLs by namespace.
  • Loads icons from URLs and extracts individual icons from icon sets.

properties.name: _data
properties.description: Stream that emits when a new data array is set on the data source.

properties.name: _filter
properties.description: Stream that emits when a new filter string is set on the data source.

properties.name: _renderChangesSubscription
properties.description: Subscription to the changes that should trigger an update to the table's rendered rows, such as filtering, sorting, pagination, or base data changes.

properties.name: _renderData
properties.description: Stream emitting render data to the table (depends on ordered data changes).

properties.name: filteredData
properties.description: The filtered set of data that has been matched by the filter string, or all the data if there is no filter. Useful for knowing the set of data the table represents. For example, a 'selectAll()' function would likely want to select the set of filtered data shown to the user rather than all the data.

properties.name: filterPredicate
properties.description: Checks if a data object matches the data source's filter string. By default, each data object is converted to a string of its properties and returns true if the filter has at least one occurrence in that string. By default, the filter string has its whitespace trimmed and the match is case-insensitive. May be overridden for a custom implementation of filter matching.

jsdoctags.comment: Data object used to check against the filter.
Filter string that has been set on the data source.
Whether the filter matches against the data

properties.name: sortData
properties.description: Gets a sorted copy of the data array based on the state of the OuiSort. Called after changes are made to the filtered data or when sort changes are emitted from OuiSort. By default, the function retrieves the active sort and its direction and compares data by retrieving data using the sortingDataAccessor. May be overridden for a custom implementation of data ordering.

jsdoctags.comment: The array of data that should be sorted.
The connected OuiSort that holds the current sort state.

properties.name: sortingDataAccessor
properties.description: Data accessor function that is used for accessing data properties for sorting through the default sortData function. This default function assumes that the sort header IDs (which defaults to the column name) matches the data's properties (e.g. column Xyz represents data['Xyz']). May be set to a custom function for different behavior.

jsdoctags.comment: The name of the column that represents the data.

classes.description:
Data source that accepts a client-side data array and includes native support of filtering, sorting (using OuiSort), and pagination (using OuiPaginator).

Allows for sort customization by overriding sortingDataAccessor, which defines how data properties are accessed. Also allows for filter customization by overriding filterTermAccessor, which defines how row data is converted to a string for filter matching.
classes.rawdescription:
Data source that accepts a client-side data array and includes native support of filtering,
sorting (using OuiSort), and pagination (using OuiPaginator).

Allows for sort customization by overriding sortingDataAccessor, which defines how data
properties are accessed. Also allows for filter customization by overriding filterTermAccessor,
which defines how row data is converted to a string for filter matching.

methods.name: _filterData
methods.description: Returns a filtered data array where each filter object contains the filter string within the result of the filterTermAccessor function. If no filter is set, returns the data array as provided.

methods.name: _orderData
methods.description: Returns a sorted copy of the data if OuiSort has a sort applied, otherwise just returns the data array as provided. Uses the default data accessor for data lookup, unless a sortDataAccessor function is defined.

methods.name: _pageData
methods.description: Returns a paged splice of the provided data array according to the provided OuiPaginator's page index and length. If there is no paginator provided, returns the data array as provided.

methods.name: _updateChangeSubscription
methods.description: Subscribe to changes that should trigger an update to the table's rendered rows. When the changes occur, process the current state of the filter, sort, and pagination along with the provided base data and send it to the table for rendering.

methods.name: _updatePaginator
methods.description: Updates the paginator to reflect the length of the filtered data, and makes sure that the page index does not exceed the paginator's last page. Values are changed in a resolved promise to guard against making property changes within a round of change detection.

methods.name: connect
methods.description: Used by the OuiTable. Called when it connects to the data source.

methods.name: disconnect
methods.description: Used by the OuiTable. Called when it is destroyed. No-op.

getSignature.name: data
getSignature.description: Array of data that should be rendered by the table, where each object represents one row.

getSignature.name: filter
getSignature.description: Filter term that should be used to filter out objects from the data array. To override how data objects match to this filter string, provide a custom function for filterPredicate.

getSignature.name: sort
getSignature.description: Instance of the OuiSort directive used by the table to control its sorting. Sort changes emitted by the OuiSort will trigger an update to the table's rendered data.

getSignature.name: paginator
getSignature.description:
Instance of the OuiPaginator component used by the table to control what page of the data is displayed. Page changes emitted by the OuiPaginator will trigger an update to the table's rendered data.

Note that the data source uses the paginator's properties to calculate which page of data should be displayed. If the paginator receives its properties as template inputs, e.g. [pageLength]=100 or [pageIndex]=1, then be sure that the paginator's view has been initialized before assigning it to this data source.

methodsClass.description: Destroys the autocomplete suggestion panel.

methodsClass.description: Returns the width of the input element, so the panel width can match it.

methodsClass.description: Stream of clicks outside of the autocomplete panel.

methodsClass.name: _resetActiveItem
methodsClass.description: Resets the active item to -1 so arrow events will activate the correct options, or to 0 if the consumer opted into it.

methodsClass.name: _scrollToOption
methodsClass.description: Given that we are not actually focusing active options, we must manually adjust scroll to reveal options below the fold. First, we find the offset of the option from the top of the panel. If that offset is below the fold, the new scrollTop will be the offset - the panel height + the option height, so the active option will be just visible at the bottom of the panel. If that offset is above the top of the visible panel, the new scrollTop will become the offset. If that offset is visible within the panel already, the scrollTop is not adjusted.

methodsClass.name: _setValueAndClose
methodsClass.description: This method closes the panel, and if a value is specified, also sets the associated control to that value. It will also mark the control as dirty if this interaction stemmed from the user.

methodsClass.name: _subscribeToClosingActions
methodsClass.description: This method listens to a stream of panel closing actions and resets the stream every time the option list changes.

methodsClass.description: Closes the autocomplete suggestion panel.

methodsClass.name: openPanel
methodsClass.description: Opens the autocomplete suggestion panel.

methodsClass.description: Updates the position of the autocomplete suggestion panel to ensure that it fits all options within the viewport.

components.description: Supports all of the functionality of an HTML5 checkbox, and exposes a similar API. A MatCheckbox can be either checked, unchecked, or disabled. Note that all additional accessibility attributes are taken care of by the component, so there is no need to provide them yourself. However, if you want to omit a label and still have the checkbox be accessible, you may supply an [aria-label] input. See: https://github.com/scheduleonce/once-ui/tree/master/ui/src/components/checkbox/README.md
components.rawdescription:
Supports all of the functionality of an HTML5 checkbox,
and exposes a similar API. A MatCheckbox can be either checked, unchecked, or
disabled. Note that all additional accessibility attributes are taken care of by the component,
so there is no need to provide them yourself. However, if you want to omit a label and still
have the checkbox be accessible, you may supply an [aria-label] input.
See: https://github.com/scheduleonce/once-ui/tree/master/ui/src/components/checkbox/README.md

components.description:
oui-icon makes it easier to use vector-based icons in your app. This directive supports only SVG icons. To associate a name with an icon URL, use the addSvgIcon. The methods of OuiIconRegistry. After registering an icon, it can be displayed by setting the svgIcon input. For an icon in the default namespace, use the name directly. Component to display an icon. It can be used in the following ways:

  • Specify the svgIcon input to load an SVG icon from a URL previously registered with the addSvgIcon, addSvgIconSet. Examples:
  • Use a font ligature as an icon by putting the ligature text in the content of the component. Example: home sun
components.rawdescription:
oui-icon makes it easier to use vector-based icons in your app. This directive supports only SVG icons.
To associate a name with an icon URL, use the addSvgIcon. The methods of OuiIconRegistry. After registering an icon, it
can be displayed by setting the svgIcon input. For an icon in the default namespace, use the name directly.
Component to display an icon. It can be used in the following ways:
-  Specify the svgIcon input to load an SVG icon from a URL previously registered with the addSvgIcon, addSvgIconSet.
    Examples:
    <oui-icon svgIcon="[name]"></oui-icon>
-  Use a font ligature as an icon by putting the ligature text in the content of the <oui-icon> component.
    Example: <oui-icon>home</oui-icon> <oui-icon>sun</oui-icon>

components.name: OuiAutocompleteGroupStorybook
components.template:
<oui-form-field
  [formGroup]="stateForm"
  [appearance]="appearance"
  style="max-width:300px;display:block;"
>
  <input
    type="text"
    formControlName="stateGroup"
    oui-input
    [ouiAutocomplete]="autoGroup"
  />
  <oui-autocomplete
    (closed)="closed()"
    (opened)="opened()"
    (optionSelected)="optionSelected($event)"
    #autoGroup="ouiAutocomplete"
    class="autocomplete-group"
    [autoActiveFirstOption]="autoActiveFirstOption"
  >
    <oui-optgroup
      *ngFor="let group of stateGroupOptions | async"
      [label]="group.letter"
    >
      <oui-option *ngFor="let name of group.names" [value]="name">
        {{ name }}
      </oui-option>
    </oui-optgroup>
  </oui-autocomplete>
</oui-form-field>

components.name: OuiAutocompleteStorybook
components.template:
<oui-form-field
  [appearance]="appearance"
  style="max-width:300px;display:block;"
>
  <input [formControl]="myControl" oui-input [ouiAutocomplete]="auto" />
</oui-form-field>
<oui-autocomplete
  (closed)="closed()"
  (opened)="opened()"
  (optionSelected)="optionSelected($event)"
  [autoActiveFirstOption]="autoActiveFirstOption"
  #auto="ouiAutocomplete"
>
  <oui-option
    *ngFor="let option of filteredOptions | async"
    [value]="option"
  >
    {{ option }}
  </oui-option>
</oui-autocomplete>

  oui-icon-button
  type="button"
  aria-haspopup="true"

  (click)="_open($event)"
>

    class="oui-datepicker-toggle-default-icon"
    viewBox="0 0 24 24"
    width="24px"
    height="24px"
    fill="currentColor"
    focusable="false"

    <path d="M2 7v-1h16v1z"></path>
    <path
      d="M5 9h2v2h-2zM9 9h2v2h-2zM13 9h2v2h-2zM5 13h2v2h-2zM9 13h2v2h-2zM13 13h2v2h-2z"

  </svg>
  <ng-content select="[ouiDatepickerToggleIcon]"></ng-content>
</button>

components.name: OuiPseudoCheckbox

inputsClass.name: disabled
inputsClass.description: Whether the checkbox is disabled.

inputsClass.name: state

components.description:
Component that shows a simplified checkbox without including any kind of "real" checkbox. Meant to be used when the checkbox is purely decorative and a large number of them will be included, such as for the options in a multi-select. Uses no SVGs or complex animations. Note that theming is meant to be handled by the parent element, e.g. oui-primary .oui-pseudo-checkbox.

Note that this component will be completely invisible to screen-reader users. This is not interchangeable with <oui-checkbox> and should not be used if the user would directly interact with the checkbox. The pseudo-checkbox should only be used as an implementation detail of more complex components that appropriately handle selected / checked state.
components.rawdescription:
Component that shows a simplified checkbox without including any kind of "real" checkbox.
Meant to be used when the checkbox is purely decorative and a large number of them will be
included, such as for the options in a multi-select. Uses no SVGs or complex animations.
Note that theming is meant to be handled by the parent element, e.g.
`oui-primary .oui-pseudo-checkbox`.

Note that this component will be completely invisible to screen-reader users. This is *not*
interchangeable with `<oui-checkbox>` and should *not* be used if the user would directly
interact with the checkbox. The pseudo-checkbox should only be used as an implementation detail
of more complex components that appropriately handle selected / checked state.

methodsClass.name: _scrollToOption
methodsClass.description: Given that we are not actually focusing active options, we must manually adjust scroll to reveal options below the fold. First, we find the offset of the option from the top of the panel. If that offset is below the fold, the new scrollTop will be the offset - the panel height + the option height, so the active option will be just visible at the bottom of the panel. If that offset is above the top of the visible panel, the new scrollTop will become the offset. If that offset is visible within the panel already, the scrollTop is not adjusted.

inputsClass.description: Overrides the disable clear value of the containing OuiSort for this OuiSortable.

inputsClass.description: ID of this sort header. If used within the context of a CdkColumnDef, this will default to the column's name.

inputsClass.description: Overrides the sort start value of the containing OuiSort for this OuiSortable.

propertiesClass.name: _arrowDirection
propertiesClass.description: The direction the arrow should be facing according to the current state.

propertiesClass.name: _disableViewStateAnimation
propertiesClass.description: Whether the view state animation should show the transition between the from and to states.

propertiesClass.name: _showIndicatorHint
propertiesClass.description: Flag set to true when the indicator should be displayed while the sort is not active. Used to provide an affordance that the header is sortable by showing on focus and hover.

propertiesClass.name: _viewState
propertiesClass.description: The view transition state of the arrow (translation/ opacity) - indicates its from and to position through the animation. If animations are currently disabled, the fromState is removed so that there is no animation displayed.

methodsClass.name: _getAriaSortAttribute
methodsClass.description: Gets the aria-sort attribute that should be applied to this sort header. If this header is not sorted, returns null so that the attribute is removed from the host element. Aria spec says that the aria-sort property should only be present on one header at a time, so removing ensures this is true.

methodsClass.name: _getArrowDirectionState
methodsClass.description: Returns the animation state for the arrow direction (indicator and pointers).

methodsClass.name: _getArrowViewState
methodsClass.description: Returns the arrow position state (opacity, translation).

methodsClass.name: _handleClick
methodsClass.description: Triggers the sort on this sort header and removes the indicator hint.

methodsClass.name: _isSorted
methodsClass.description: Whether this OuiSortHeader is currently sorted in either ascending or descending order.

methodsClass.name: _setAnimationTransitionState
methodsClass.description: Sets the animation transition view state for the arrow's position and opacity. If the disableViewStateAnimation flag is set to true, the fromState will be ignored so that no animation appears.

methodsClass.name: _setIndicatorHintVisible
methodsClass.description: Sets the "hint" state such that the arrow will be semi-transparently displayed as a hint to the user showing what the active sort will become. If set to false, the arrow will fade away.

methodsClass.name: _updateArrowDirection
methodsClass.description: Updates the direction the arrow should be pointing. If it is not sorted, the arrow should be facing the start direction. Otherwise if it is sorted, the arrow should point in the currently active sorted direction. The reason this is updated through a function is because the direction should only be changed at specific times - when deactivated but the hint is displayed and when the sort is active and the direction changes. Otherwise the arrow's direction should linger in cases such as the sort becoming deactivated but we want to animate the arrow away while preserving its direction, even though the next sort direction is actually different and should only be changed once the arrow displays again (hint or activation).

components.description:
Applies sorting behavior (click to change sort) and styles to an element, including an arrow to display the current sort direction.

Must be provided with an id and contained within a parent OuiSort directive.

If used on header cells in a CdkTable, it will automatically default its id from its containing column definition.
components.rawdescription:
Applies sorting behavior (click to change sort) and styles to an element, including an
arrow to display the current sort direction.

Must be provided with an id and contained within a parent OuiSort directive.

If used on header cells in a CdkTable, it will automatically default its id from its containing
column definition.

() => ({
  moduleMetadata: {
    imports: [
      OuiDatepickerModule,
      OuiFormFieldModule,
      OuiInputModule,
      BrowserAnimationsModule,
    ],
    schemas: [],

    declarations: [OuiDatepickerCustomStorybook],
  },
  template: `<oui-datepicker-custom-storybook 
    [value]="value" 
    [disabled]="disabled" 
    [appearance]="appearance"
    [startView]="startView" 
    [color]="color" 
    [opened]="opened" 
    [mindate]="minDate" 
    [maxdate]="maxDate"
    (_closed)="closed($event)"
    (_monthSelected)="monthSelected($event)"
    (_opened)="datepickeropened($event)"
    (_yearSelected)="yearSelected($event)"
    (_dateChange)="dateChange($event)"></oui-datepicker-custom-storybook>`,
  props: {
    closed: action('closed'),
    monthSelected: action('monthSelected'),
    datepickeropened: action('opened'),
    yearSelected: action('yearSelected'),
    dateChange: action('dateChange'),
    color: select('color', COLORS, COLORS[0], 'OuiDatepicker'),
    startView: select(
      'start-view',
      START_VIEWS,
      START_VIEWS[0],
      'OuiDatepicker'
    ),
    opened: boolean('opened', false, 'OuiDatepicker'),
    disabled: boolean('disabled', false, 'OuiDatepicker'),
    minDate: date('minDate', CURRENT_DATE, 'OuiDatepickerInput'),
    maxDate: date('maxDate', MAX_DATE, 'OuiDatepickerInput'),
    value: date('value', CURRENT_DATE, 'OuiDatepickerInput'),
    appearance: select(
      'appearance',
      APPEARANCE,
      APPEARANCE[1],
      'OuiDatepickerInput'
    ),
  },
})
